subject: Sexual Health
title: Male Age and Fertility
description: A 60-second lesson on Male Age and Fertility.

hook.text: Unlike the myth, men do not stay fertile forever. Male fertility declines significantly after age 40.

buildup.text: Older men have lower sperm counts, reduced motility, and higher rates of DNA fragmentation.

discovery.text: Paternal age over 40 is linked to higher risks of miscarriage, autism, and schizophrenia in offspring.

twist.text: The biological clock is not only a female concern. Men's reproductive window also has real limits.

climax.text: Acknowledging male age-related fertility decline leads to better family planning for both partners.

punchline.text: Men have a biological clock too. It just ticks slower.

quiz.question: After what age does male fertility decline significantly?
